page.title: 01MOORLAND NEAR POSTBRIDGE
page.content: The area is part of Southern Dartmoor south of Postbridge. Moderately high with tors rising to around 350'. The landscape is predominately uncultivated heath and moorland but with large coniferous plantations stretching away North-West in the area of Bellever Tor and Laughter Hole but also some enclosed farm and grazing land particularly around Bellever, Cator and Babeny. The East Dart flows almost north south across the area between the Bellever Tor and Riddon Ridge on the east. Moderate expanses of bogland occur to the south west and north east around Walla Brook. The area is sparsely populated and except for a few isolated farms such as Dury and Babeny the inhabitants live in Bellever. There are mostly Forestry Commission workers. The area is recreational with a Youth Hostel and
